title: FPS lower than usual, frames feel laggy
body:
Since patch 7.11 I've experienced quite a bit of lag. Earlier I had lag spikes even though my ping and fps display weren't changing much, I was trying to let my team know and they're like "pfft 80 ping isn't that bad" even though the entire screen would freeze. That problem hasn't happened today, but instead I'm at a constant 30-40 FPS when I'm usually 60+. My ping is stable at 28, but when I roll my screen over around the map the visuals feel clunky. Restarting the client and restarting my computer hasn't fixed it.

This issue is also right after the recent Windows 10 update I got last night that installed Paint 3d and whatever the hell else Microsoft decided I need.

replies.body: I'm on a MAC (one of the older ones that had a problem launching league, that's fixed now at least) and I too am only getting a constant 30 FPS when i was normally getting 60. I already was unable to play League for 2 weeks because of the MAC issues, and now I have FPS issues too :[

You mentioned that this started happening right after the Windows 10 update, so I'm actually curious if the update re-enabled the XBox Game Bar which has been known to give some players FPS problems. Try looking for and [**disabling the Game Bar**](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) again if it was turned back on, but if that doesn't help let me know and we can dig a little further!

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Kb67tPF3,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2017-06-04T19:34:03.498+0000)
>
> You mentioned that this started happening right after the Windows 10 update, so I'm actually curious if the update re-enabled the XBox Game Bar which has been known to give some players FPS problems. Try looking for and [**disabling the Game Bar**](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) again if it was turned back on, but if that doesn't help let me know and we can dig a little further!

Thanks for comin in Broporo. Unfortunately disabling the game bar hasn't fixed the issue. I've climbed up to a more consistent ~45 fps, but moving the camera still doesn't feel smooth.

No worries, I'm here to serve ^_^

It's good your FPS went up a little, but a little isn't good enough!! I want you to get a little more in-depth help from our tech guys, so shoot them a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). Make sure to send them some logs which you can get using the [**Hextech Repair Tool**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool), and they can look into those to see what's up.

I've dropped from 200-300FPS to 30-70FPS after patch 7.11

Latest AMD beta drivers (unchanged from prior), and no changes to Windows installation.  Not been able to do anything to get it better.

No other games are suffering.
